dt: {bc}controlled or affected by or as if by a magic spell

dt.t: … as if he were not my great-grandfather at all but some mournful, {wi}bewitched{/wi} old huntsman from a storybook, tongue-tied by the bad fairy, unable to speak.
As though the ship were {wi}bewitched{/wi}, from the moment they left Saybrook everything went wrong.

dt: {bc}influenced, attracted, or charmed as if by magic

dt.t: Until his death at 36, Byron continued a course of sybaritic abandon, traveling with an entourage {wi}bewitched{/wi} by his escapades and terrified by his mood swings and violent temper.

shortdef: controlled or affected by or as if by a magic spell : influenced, attracted, or charmed as if by magic

dt: {bc}to influence or affect especially injuriously by witchcraft
{bc}to attract as if by the power of witchcraft {bc}{sx|enchant||}, {sx|fascinate||}

shortdef: to influence or affect especially injuriously by witchcraft
to attract as if by the power of witchcraft : enchant, fascinate
